page.title: 13Penharget Farm.
page.content: {Penharget Farm}was mentioned in the first Domesday Book. Then it had 30 acres with 1 plough, 3 cows, 2 pigs, 30 sheep and 6 goats. Six villagers and their families lived there. Today it is owned by Mr. David Tucker as part of a family business with his father and brother, who have another farm just a few miles away. He has 252 {Longwool sheep}and 185 lambs which are kept for meat and wool. He has 136 {Friesian cattle.}The steers go for beef and the heifers for milking at the other farm. Each year he cuts grass for making{hay}and{silage}and he grows about 60 acres of{barley}for feeding to his animals. He grows several acres of{potatoes}which are mostly sold to farmers in West Cornwall for seed. Nowadays only three men work on the farm.
